availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Jones Gregory (Graves County, KY, soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from January 6, 1862 to February 5, 1862. Served in the 1st Regiment Capital Guards, Paducah Battalion as captain from June 24, 1864 to February 12, 1865. Captain in a guerrilla hunting unit in March 1865. Killed by guerrillas in Hickman County in March 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 54, 765.
Berry Craig, Kentucky Confederates: Secession, Civil War, and the Jackson Purchase (Lexington: The University Press of Kentucky, 2014), 287-288.
Find A Grave, "Thomas Gregory (Birth-Death)," Memorial #84019262, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84019262 (accessed March 2, 2020).
